channel.title: Call Of Duty: Black Ops Trailer released.
channel.description:
[url='https://kotaku.com/5526560/first-look-at-next-call-of-duty-happens-this-friday']Kotaku - First Look at COD7[/url]
[url='https://www.gametrailers.com/video/exclusive-debut-call-of/64933']Call Of Duty Black Ops - World Exclusive Teaser Trailer - Gametrailers.com[/url] [quote] There's a brand new Call of Duty game coming this year. This Friday, you'll get your first peek at the follow-up to Call of Duty: Modern Warfare 2, courtesy of GameTrailers TV. While Activision may be embroiled in drama related to its most recent Call of Duty, that won't stop the company from churning out annual sequels to the ultra-popular first-person shooter. In 2010, Call of Duty: World at War developer Treyarch is on tap to deliver a new iteration, already penciled in to ship before the "holiday." It represents the first Call of Duty game to be released under publisher Activision's new "strategic plans" for the franchise. GameTrailers TV's promo promises a "global announcement" and "the first teaser trailer" for Call of Duty 7, so make sure you're up at 12:40 a.m. with your eyes glued to Spike TV to catch it. Episode 310 Promo [GameTrailers TV] [/quote] I hope they work harder on this one tbh, because it looks nice.

item.title: Call Of Duty: Black Ops Trailer released.
item.dc:creator: Bobikan00sh
item.description:
watching frame by frame something strikes me. it looks like black ops will stretch from end of Nam to early future. and the way they talk to the “patient” in the video it looks as though all the clips are his memories. will he be a clone or something? and is call of duty going sci-fi?
i gotta be honest this doesn’t look like a step in the right direction especially after MW2

Read full topic

item.description:
Nazi Zombies was so much fun! And BTW, MW2 wasn’t that bad. That said, it and CoDWaW are the only two CoDs I’ve played so what seems old and repeated to you is new and fresh to me.

item.description:
Dont feed the troll. If he actually knew anything then he would’ve known that all the COD games are linear, monotonous, and predictable. MW2 is no exception to that.

item.source: Call Of Duty: Black Ops Trailer released.

item.title: Call Of Duty: Black Ops Trailer released.
item.dc:creator: Cool2
item.description:
StriderWSI:

I so freaking hate Treyarch.
At least for making World at War!
No, seriously, comparing to MW2 it was waaaaaaaaaay too linear, monotonous and predictable.
Isn’t that right?

What…? At least WaW had a good single player, MW2 got really boring really quick. Following people around for the entire game, yeah, no thanks. Complete waste of my 60 bucks… Serves me right for buying another Cod game after CoD4.

Read full topic

item.title: Call Of Duty: Black Ops Trailer released.
item.dc:creator: Cobra
item.description:
Hell, as long as it’s not WWII I’ll try it.
But if it has exaggerated dismemberment like Waw, It’s not worth buying.
I understand WaW, it was fun. but nothing funny, just some crappy dark humor.

More like Cod 3 for Treyarch: “GET OUT OF THE WAY YOU FAT SCOTTISH TWIT!”

MW2 was relatively funny: " Shit’s falling from the sky, the Russians got us outnumbered, we’re screwed man, totally screwe- SHUT UP!!

Read full topic

item.source: Call Of Duty: Black Ops Trailer released.

item.title: Call Of Duty: Black Ops Trailer released.
item.dc:creator: punisher1565
item.description:
CerebralError:

I wouldn’t say that Treyarch sucks. While I’ll admit CoD3 was a pretty crappy game, WaW was actually quite good.

Here’s what I’ve noticed about Treyarch’s Call of Duty games - they try new things. CoD3 - They attempted ‘melee events’, context sensitive moments - like setting the fuses on a satchel charge. I think they also tried implementing ragdolls. Also, CoD3 was the first game to have the ability to throw grenades back. I would add that they added controllable vehicles, but I remember CoD2 had two tank levels.

WaW had co-op campaign, dismemberment, yes, Nazi Zombies - although I don’t really consider that an ‘innovation’.

So, while Infinity Ward is more consistent, Treyarch tries new things in their games. They might not always work, but at least they try.

…

too bad call of duty is the most un-original game to ever exist.

Read full topic
